result.execSummary:
The defendant Mari Patricia Isham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Interfere w/ Custody-Beyond Visitation, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.31(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:06 PM Defendant Mari Patricia Isham in court with attorney James Donald McKenzie.  Defendant Mari Patricia Isham in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court has discussion with Attny McKenzie and State regarding proceeding.  Attny Jon Padgham appearrs in court for the Public Defender Office, Covering for Attny Ryan Reid.   Court has discussion with DEF regarding proceeding, DEF agrees to proceed with all understanding on absense of Attny Ryan Reid.   
Attny McKenzie received the revocation packet and reviewed with DEF.   State received revocation packet and reviewed.    State proceeds with statement prior to sentencing.   Attny McKenzie proceeds with statement prior to sentencing.  DEF makes statement to court.    Court makes statement to all parties.  Court to follow agreement.  

COURT;  8 years prison.  4 years initial confinement, and 4 years extended supervison.   474 days credit.   Any unpaid court obligations are to be converted to Clerk of Court collect and civil judgment will be entered.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
